items.name: Featured Story - GOP Lawmaker Insists People Can 'Keep Their Medicaid' If They 'Just Get a Job'
items.content:
GOP Lawmaker Insists People Can 'Keep Their Medicaid' If They 'Just Get a Job'

How to Live Better, Longer

As the GOP works to complete its "big, beautiful bill," Rep.Dan Crenshaw(R-TX) defended proposed work requirements for Medicaidrecipients.

Rep. Dan Crenshaw on Medicaid: "The person we're taking it away from is the able-bodied adult with no children who refuses to work."pic.twitter.com/G 4Mm ZCAc MA

House Republicans have been tasked with finding $880 billion in Medicaid savings over the next decade — a substantial hurdle for lawmakers beholden to voters, 76% of whom oppose cuts to Medicaid, according to a recent KFFpoll. Rather thanexplicitly cutting services, the GOP is reportedly looking to save money with work requirements for "able-bodied adults" who receive Medicaid.

🡒 See the full breakdown
